Question: "I check what’s assigned to me and make note of it."
"I try to finish tasks even when they feel hard or boring."
"I ask for clarification if I don’t fully understand my task."
"I don’t wait till the last minute to begin my work."
"I update my lead if I am stuck or need more time."
"If I say I’ll do something, I try my best to deliver it."
"I follow up after meetings or discussions to ensure clarity."
"I don’t shift blame if something goes wrong in my task."
"I ensure my work is complete before submitting it."
"I ask what’s expected when the task isn’t clearly defined."
"I admit when I made a mistake without making excuses."
"I try to fix my errors as soon as I notice them."
"I listen to feedback about my mistakes without getting defensive."
"I ask for help to understand how to avoid the same mistake next time."
"I take responsibility for the quality of my own work."
"I show up on time for meetings and check-ins."
"I keep my promises to my teammates."
"I am consistent in how I perform my daily tasks."
"I don’t ignore messages or requests related to my work."
"I stay focused on my tasks during work hours."
"I look for the next task to do once I finish mine."
"I suggest small ways to make my own work better."
"I keep my workspace (digital or physical) organized."
"I try to solve small blockers on my own before asking for help."
"I show interest in learning how my work helps the team."
"I try to stay calm when plans suddenly change."
"If I’m confused by a new instruction, I ask for help instead of getting frustrated."
"I don’t panic if someone gives feedback or correction."
"I accept that changes happen even if I don’t like them."
"I adjust when deadlines shift or priorities change."
"I think about what I could do better after finishing a task."
"I try not to repeat the same mistakes."
"I listen when someone shares how they solved something."
"I try again if something didn’t work the first time."
"I take notes or save examples that help me understand better."
"I ask questions when I want to understand a concept better."
"I ask peers how they approached a similar task."
"I show curiosity about new tools or ways of working."
"I ask for feedback to know where I can improve."
"I listen actively during training or knowledge-sharing sessions."
"I am willing to try a different way of doing a task if suggested."
"I don’t say “that’s impossible” before trying it."
"I am open to working with different people or teams."
"I try to learn from the different styles of my teammates."
"I accept new assignments with a positive attitude."
"I spend time practicing a new skill until I get it right."
"I look for small ways to be faster or better at my work."
"I use the tools and templates the team provides."
"I follow new processes once they are explained to me."
"I show that I am eager to grow and learn more."
"I try to speak clearly when asked what I worked on"
"I attempt to finish my sentence even when I feel nervous"
"If someone looks confused, I try saying it in another way"
"I speak slowly so others can understand me better"
"I try not to use casual words during formal conversations"
"When I don’t understand something, I ask questions"
"I raise my hand or drop a message if I need help"
"I ask others to repeat if I missed part of the instruction"
"I confirm details before starting a task (e.g., deadline or goal)"
"I ask for examples if I don’t fully understand what’s explained"
"I look at the person (or screen) when they are talking to me"
"I wait for the other person to finish before I start speaking"
"I try to understand the other person’s point of view"
"I avoid using my phone or doing other work during meetings"
"I say “thank you” or acknowledge when someone helps me"
"I use polite greetings (like Hi, Hello) in my messages"
"I try to keep my messages short and easy to read"
"I reply to direct messages within a reasonable time"
"I use clear subject lines when I send an email"
"I check my spelling before I hit send on an important message"
"I try to share my opinion when asked in a group"
"I listen to feedback on how I speak or write"
"I try to apply suggestions to improve my communication"
"I am okay with admitting when I don’t know an answer"
"I show appreciation for support or guidance I receive"
"I pause to read/listen carefully before starting a task."
"I try to understand “why” the task matters before I begin."
"If something doesn’t make sense, I ask for clarification."
"I double-check what is expected (outcome, format, etc.) before I start."
"I try to understand the full picture—not just my piece."
"I break down large tasks into small steps before starting."
"I think about which step should come first."
"I write down to-do items or make simple lists."
"I try to spot patterns (e.g., this kind of bug always happens after update)."
"I check my assumptions when unsure (“Do I know this for sure?”)."
"I look at past examples or references before starting a task."
"I ask where to find information if I am lost."
"I check my work against a checklist if one is provided."
"I try to search for answers (e.g., in documentation) before asking."
"I keep notes of important instructions or facts."
"I review my work at least once before submitting it."
"I look for common errors (like typos or missing files)."
"I check if my final result matches what was requested."
"I test my work (e.g., run the code or re-read the mail) to ensure it works."
"I ask a buddy or lead to do a quick check if it's my first time."
"I flag a problem as soon as I realize I can’t solve it alone."
"I try to explain what I’ve already tried when asking for help."
"I stay calm when a problem occurs."
"I learn from the solution so I don’t get stuck on the same thing again."
"I follow the steps suggested by my lead to fix an issue."
"I try to complete my part of the task on time so the team isn't delayed"
"I stay available when teammates ask for my input or support"
"I respond when someone checks in with me about a group task"
"I join group activities or calls when invited"
"I follow through on things I agreed to do"
"I listen to teammates even if I don’t fully agree"
"I avoid speaking over others in meetings or chats"
"I respect different styles or ideas from my team members"
"I don’t make fun of others, even in jokes"
"I stay polite even if I’m stressed or tired"
"I share useful resources (links, notes, code) when I find them"
"I help teammates when I see they are stuck"
"I explain things I know to help a teammate learn"
"I offer to help with small tasks if I finish my work early"
"I share credit with others when we finish a task together"
"I use team tools (like Slack or trackers) to stay connected"
"I keep my status updated so the team knows where I am"
"I follow the team’s rules for meetings or documentation"
"I show up for team discussions prepared"
"I try to be a positive member of the group"
"I try to solve small misunderstandings by talking directly"
"I ask for help from a lead if a teammate and I can’t agree"
"I focus on the work, not on personal feelings during a disagreement"
"I am open to suggestions from others on how to work better"
"I apologize if I realize I made a mistake that affected the team"
